20101206010012.000|20101206010014.500|CCO|>>> JOHN LENNON HAS BEEN SHOT.
20101206010014.500|20101206011111.000|SEG|Type=Story
20101206010014.500|20101206010017.000|CCO|>>> DECEMBER 8, 1980.
20101206010017.000|20101206010019.500|CCO|>> PEOPLE HERE IN BRITAIN ARE 
20101206010019.500|20101206010022.000|CCO|SHOCKED AND SADDENED.
20101206010022.000|20101206010027.000|CCO|>> AN ICON LOST, A FAMILY IN 
20101206010027.000|20101206010032.000|CCO|MOURNING, A WORLD WONDERING WHY.
20101206010032.000|20101206010033.667|CCO|30 YEARS LATER, THOSE WHO WERE 
20101206010033.667|20101206010035.333|CCO|THERE SPEAK OUT.
20101206010035.333|20101206010037.000|CCO|>> HE JUST SHOT LENNON.
20101206010037.000|20101206010038.667|CCO|>> EXCLUSIVE RECORDINGS OF A 
20101206010038.667|20101206010040.333|CCO|KILLER.
20101206010040.333|20101206010042.000|CCO|>> I HEARD BOOM, BOOM, BOOM.
20101206010042.000|20101206010045.333|CCO|>> Narrator: AN INSIDER'S LOOK 
20101206010045.333|20101206010048.667|CCO|AT THE MURDER OF A LEGEND.
20101206010048.667|20101206010102.000|CCO|"LOSING LENNON: COUNTDOWN TO 
20101206010102.000|20101206010105.333|CCO|MURDER."
20101206010105.333|20101206010108.667|CCO|>> HERE WE ARE, I'M GOING TO BE 
20101206010108.667|20101206010112.000|CCO|40, LIFE BEGINS AT 40, SO THEY 
20101206010112.000|20101206010117.000|CCO|PROMISED.
20101206010117.000|20101206010122.000|CCO|>> Narrator: OCTOBER 9, 1980, 
20101206010122.000|20101206010124.500|CCO|WAS A DAY OF CELEBRATION, A 
20101206010124.500|20101206010127.000|CCO|FATHER AND SON WHO REMARKABLY 
20101206010127.000|20101206010129.500|CCO|SHARED THE SAME BIRTHDAY.
20101206010129.500|20101206010132.000|CCO|IT WAS A BIG ONE FOR JOHN LENNON
20101206010132.000|20101206010134.000|CCO|NON, HE WAS TURNING 40, AT THE 
20101206010134.000|20101206010136.000|CCO|SAME TIME HE WAS TURNING A PAGE 
20101206010136.000|20101206010138.000|CCO|IN HIS LIFE, ONE THAT WOULD PUT 
20101206010138.000|20101206010140.000|CCO|HIM BACK ON TOP OF THE CHARTS 
20101206010140.000|20101206010142.000|CCO|AND PROPEL HIM BACK INTO THE 
20101206010142.000|20101206010143.667|CCO|SPOTLIGHT.
20101206010143.667|20101206010145.333|CCO|>> IT WAS REALLY UNIQUE THAT 
20101206010145.333|20101206010147.000|CCO|JOHN AND SEAN HAD THE SAME BIRTH
20101206010147.000|20101206010148.667|CCO|DATE.
20101206010148.667|20101206010150.333|CCO|>> Narrator: BOB GRUEN WAS 
20101206010150.333|20101206010152.000|CCO|LENNON'S PERSONAL PHOTOGRAPHER.
20101206010152.000|20101206010153.125|CCO|HE WAS THERE FOR THEIR JOINT 
20101206010153.125|20101206010154.250|CCO|CELEBRATION AT NEW YORK'S 
20101206010154.250|20101206010155.375|CCO|LEGENDARY TAVERN ON THE GREEN.
20101206010155.375|20101206010156.500|CCO|>> I REMEMBER A LOT OF THE 
20101206010156.500|20101206010157.625|CCO|LITTLE KIDS RUNNING AROUND AND 
20101206010157.625|20101206010158.750|CCO|SCREAMING, A TYPICAL BIRTHDAY 
20101206010158.750|20101206010159.875|CCO|BETTER AND ALL THE COLORFUL 
20101206010159.875|20101206010201.000|CCO|THINGS GOING ON AND JOHN WAS 
20101206010201.000|20101206010203.000|CCO|VERY HAPPY TO BE THERE AND TO BE
20101206010203.000|20101206010205.000|CCO|WITH HIS SON.
20101206010205.000|20101206010207.000|CCO|>> HOW SIGNIFICANT WAS HIS 40th 
20101206010207.000|20101206010209.000|CCO|BIRTHDAY?
20101206010209.000|20101206010211.000|CCO|>> HE WROTE THE SONG "STARTING 
20101206010211.000|20101206010212.667|CCO|OVER" ABOUT THAT.
20101206010212.667|20101206010214.333|CCO|THAT HE REALLY FELT THAT LIFE 
20101206010214.333|20101206010216.000|CCO|BEGINS AT 40.
20101206010216.000|20101206010217.667|CCO|>> Narrator: LENNON WRITING A 
20101206010217.667|20101206010219.333|CCO|SONG AFTER 30 YEARS OF 
20101206010219.333|20101206010221.000|CCO|SECLUSION.
20101206010221.000|20101206010224.333|CCO|
20101206010224.333|20101206010227.667|CCO|FROM 1975 TO 1980, LENNON WAS 
20101206010227.667|20101206010231.000|CCO|OUT OF THE PUBLIC EYE AND OUT OF
20101206010231.000|20101206010234.333|CCO|THE BUSINESS OF MAKING RECORDS.
20101206010234.333|20101206010237.667|CCO|AFTER SHAUN WAS BORN, HE HAD AN 
20101206010237.667|20101206010241.000|CCO|EPIPHANY, THERE WAS MORE TO LIFE
20101206010241.000|20101206010243.000|CCO|THAN ROCK 'N ROLL.
20101206010243.000|20101206010245.000|CCO|>> IT'S NOT TO HAVE A HIT 
20101206010245.000|20101206010247.000|CCO|RECORD, I HAVE DISCOVERED I CAN 
20101206010247.000|20101206010249.000|CCO|LIVE WITHOUT IT.
20101206010249.000|20101206010251.000|CCO|>> Narrator: JOHN LENNON JUST 
20101206010251.000|20101206010253.500|CCO|WANTED TO BE A DAD.
20101206010253.500|20101206010256.000|CCO|IT WAS A LONG, HARD ROAD TO GET 
20101206010256.000|20101206010258.500|CCO|THERE.
20101206010258.500|20101206010301.000|CCO|TRYING TO HAVE A BABY, YOKO ONO 
20101206010301.000|20101206010303.000|CCO|HAD THREE MISCARRIAGES.
20101206010303.000|20101206010305.000|CCO|WHEN HE FINALLY ARRIVED, 
20101206010305.000|20101206010307.000|CCO|LENNONWAS TRANSFORMED.
20101206010307.000|20101206010309.000|CCO|>> I LOOKED AFTER THE BABY AND I
20101206010309.000|20101206010311.000|CCO|WAS A HOUSE HUSBAND AND I'M 
20101206010311.000|20101206010313.500|CCO|PROUD OF IT.
20101206010313.500|20101206010316.000|CCO|AND IT WAS AN ENLIGHTENING 
20101206010316.000|20101206010318.500|CCO|EXPERIENCE FOR ME BECAUSE IT WAS
20101206010318.500|20101206010321.000|CCO|A COMPLETE REVERSAL OF MY WHOLE 
20101206010321.000|20101206010323.000|CCO|UPBRINGING.
20101206010323.000|20101206010325.000|CCO|>> Narrator: JOHN LENNON WAS 
20101206010325.000|20101206010327.000|CCO|RAISED BY HIS MOTHER AND AUNT.
20101206010327.000|20101206010329.000|CCO|BY ALL ACCOUNTS, JOHN WANTED TO 
20101206010329.000|20101206010331.000|CCO|BE ALL THAT HE NEVER HAD.
20101206010331.000|20101206010333.000|CCO|AND THE FATHER HE NEVER WAS TO 
20101206010333.000|20101206010335.000|CCO|FIRST SON, JULIAN.
20101206010335.000|20101206010337.000|CCO|>> THE TIME THAT HE WAS AWAY 
20101206010337.000|20101206010339.000|CCO|FROM ME, HE DIDN'T REALLY HAVE A
20101206010339.000|20101206010341.000|CCO|CHOICE.
20101206010341.000|20101206010342.667|CCO|WHEN THE BEATLES TOOK OFF IN THE
20101206010342.667|20101206010344.333|CCO|EARLY DAYS, HE WAS OUT ON THE 
20101206010344.333|20101206010346.000|CCO|ROAD AND THERE WAS NO QUESTION 
20101206010346.000|20101206010347.667|CCO|OF HIM HAVING A BREAK AT THAT 
20101206010347.667|20101206010349.333|CCO|TIME.
20101206010349.333|20101206010351.000|CCO|>> Narrator: WHEN JULIAN WAS 
20101206010351.000|20101206010353.500|CCO|BORN IN 1963, THE LENNONS KEPT 
20101206010353.500|20101206010356.000|CCO|HIM A SECRET, FEARFUL THAT FANS 
20101206010356.000|20101206010358.500|CCO|WOULD REJECT BEATLE THAT WAS 
20101206010358.500|20101206010401.000|CCO|BOTH MARRIED AND A PARENT.
20101206010401.000|20101206010404.333|CCO|HE WAS ALWAYS ON THE ROAD, 
20101206010404.333|20101206010407.667|CCO|RARELY HOME.
20101206010407.667|20101206010411.000|CCO|THEN HE MET YOKO ONO, DIVORCED 
20101206010411.000|20101206010412.250|CCO|JULIAN'S MOTHER, THEN IN AUGUST 
20101206010412.250|20101206010413.500|CCO|OF 1971, MOVED TO NEW YORK CITY,
20101206010413.500|20101206010414.750|CCO|LEAVING BEHIND AN 8-YEAR-OLD SON
20101206010414.750|20101206010416.000|CCO|HE BARELY KNEW.
20101206010416.000|20101206010417.250|CCO|>> IT'S GOT TO BE TOUGH FOR A 
20101206010417.250|20101206010418.500|CCO|KID.
20101206010418.500|20101206010419.750|CCO|>> OF COURSE.
20101206010419.750|20101206010421.000|CCO|VERY TOUGH.
20101206010421.000|20101206010422.429|CCO|BUT I KNEW LIFE WITHOUT HIM MORE
20101206010422.429|20101206010423.857|CCO|THAN WITH HIM.
20101206010423.857|20101206010425.286|CCO|>> Narrator: THE MOVE TO NEW 
20101206010425.286|20101206010426.714|CCO|YORK PUT AN OCEAN BETWEEN JOHN 
20101206010426.714|20101206010428.143|CCO|AND JULIAN.
20101206010428.143|20101206010429.571|CCO|ONE THE OLDER LENNON WOULD COME 
20101206010429.571|20101206010431.000|CCO|TO REGRET.
20101206010431.000|20101206010433.500|CCO|AT THE SAME TIME IT WAS 
20101206010433.500|20101206010436.000|CCO|LIBERATING, A RELEASE FROM THE 
20101206010436.000|20101206010438.500|CCO|INTENSE SCRUTINY AT HOME IN 
20101206010438.500|20101206010441.000|CCO|ENGLAND, SOMETHING LENNON TOLD 
20101206010441.000|20101206010442.429|CCO|TOM SNYDER BEFORE HIS DEATH. 
20101206010442.429|20101206010443.857|CCO|>> HAVING GONE THROUGH THE 
20101206010443.857|20101206010445.286|CCO|BEATLE MANIA THING, NOWADAYS 
20101206010445.286|20101206010446.714|CCO|IT'S NOTHING LIKE THAT, I CAN 
20101206010446.714|20101206010448.143|CCO|WALK DOWN THE STREET AND PEOPLE 
20101206010448.143|20101206010449.571|CCO|WILL SAY, OH, HI, JOHN.
20101206010449.571|20101206010451.000|CCO|IF IT'S IN NEW YORK, RIGHT?
20101206010451.000|20101206010453.000|CCO|AND THEY DON'T HASSLE ME, I 
20101206010453.000|20101206010455.000|CCO|MIGHT SIGN ONE AUTOGRAPH, TWO 
20101206010455.000|20101206010457.000|CCO|AUTOGRAPHS, YOU KNOW?
20101206010457.000|20101206010459.000|CCO|>> I EVENTUALLY GOT BRAVE ENOUGH
20101206010459.000|20101206010501.000|CCO|TO DRIVE DOWN.
20101206010501.000|20101206010502.667|CCO|TO THE DAKOTA.
20101206010502.667|20101206010504.333|CCO|>> JERRY MALL WAS ONE OF THOSE 
20101206010504.333|20101206010506.000|CCO|FANS.
20101206010506.000|20101206010507.667|CCO|SHE GAME AN ALMOST PERMANENT 
20101206010507.667|20101206010509.333|CCO|FIXTURE OUTSIDE THE DAKOTA
20101206010509.333|20101206010511.000|CCO|OVER TIME THE LENNONS CAME TO 
20101206010511.000|20101206010512.667|CCO|TRUST HER, ENOUGH THAT SHE WENT 
20101206010512.667|20101206010514.333|CCO|ON FAMILY OUTINGS AND CAPTURED 
20101206010514.333|20101206010516.000|CCO|.
20101206010516.000|20101206010517.667|CCO|MANY UNGUARDED MOMENTS WITH 
20101206010517.667|20101206010519.333|CCO|JOHN, YOKO AND JOHN.
20101206010519.333|20101206010521.000|CCO|>> HE LIKED THE ANONYMITY OF NEW
20101206010521.000|20101206010523.000|CCO|YORK, BEING ABLE TO COME AND GO 
20101206010523.000|20101206010525.000|CCO|LIKE A NEW YORKER.
20101206010525.000|20101206010527.000|CCO|>> Narrator: IN THE SUMMER OF 
20101206010527.000|20101206010529.000|CCO|1980, SHAUN WAS OLD ENOUGH TO 
20101206010529.000|20101206010531.000|CCO|START SCHOOL.
20101206010531.000|20101206010533.000|CCO|AFTER FIVE YEARS AS A 
20101206010533.000|20101206010535.000|CCO|SELF-DESCRIBED HOUSE HUSBAND, 
20101206010535.000|20101206010537.000|CCO|LENNON WAS READY FOR NEW 
20101206010537.000|20101206010539.000|CCO|ADVENTURES.
20101206010539.000|20101206010541.000|CCO|HE TOOK UP SAILING, AND AFTER 
20101206010541.000|20101206010543.500|CCO|WEEKS OF INTENSE LESSONS FOUND 
20101206010543.500|20101206010546.000|CCO|HIMSELF ON A TRIP TO BERMUDA.
20101206010546.000|20101206010548.500|CCO|IN THE MIDDLE OF A FIERCE SQUALL
20101206010548.500|20101206010551.000|CCO|AND IN DEEP TROUBLE.
20101206010551.000|20101206010553.000|CCO|>> AT SOME POINT DURING THE 
20101206010553.000|20101206010555.000|CCO|STORM, HE TOOK THE HELM AND IT 
20101206010555.000|20101206010557.000|CCO|WAS ALMOST A LIFE THREATENING.
20101206010557.000|20101206010559.000|CCO|>> Narrator: JACK DOUGLAS WAS 
20101206010559.000|20101206010601.000|CCO|LENNON'S RECORD PRODUCER AND A 
20101206010601.000|20101206010604.333|CCO|CLOSE FRIEND.
20101206010604.333|20101206010607.667|CCO|>> HOW DID THAT WHOLE EPISODE 
20101206010607.667|20101206010611.000|CCO|CHANGE HIS LIFE?
20101206010611.000|20101206010612.429|CCO|>> YOU BECOME MORE APPRECIATIVE 
20101206010612.429|20101206010613.857|CCO|OF THE LITTLE THINGS THAT YOU DO
20101206010613.857|20101206010615.286|CCO|HAVE.
20101206010615.286|20101206010616.714|CCO|AND I THINK THAT WAS REFLECTED 
20101206010616.714|20101206010618.143|CCO|IN THE MUSIC IN THAT HE SAID, 
20101206010618.143|20101206010619.571|CCO|OKAY, IT'S TIME.
20101206010619.571|20101206010621.000|CCO|I'M DOING THIS.
20101206010621.000|20101206010622.429|CCO|BECAUSE TOMORROW MIGHT NOT BE 
20101206010622.429|20101206010623.857|CCO|HERE.
20101206010623.857|20101206010625.286|CCO|>> Narrator: SO ALL BY HIMSELF, 
20101206010625.286|20101206010626.714|CCO|ALONE IN BERMUDA, LENNON WROTE 
20101206010626.714|20101206010628.143|CCO|AND RECORDED THESE DEMOS WHO 
20101206010628.143|20101206010629.571|CCO|WHAT WOULD BECOME HIS FINAL 
20101206010629.571|20101206010631.000|CCO|ALBUMS, DOUBLE FANTASY AND MILK 
20101206010631.000|20101206010636.000|CCO|AND HONEY.
20101206010636.000|20101206010641.000|CCO| PEOPLE SAY I'M CRAZY 
20101206010641.000|20101206010642.667|CCO| DOING WHAT I'M DOING 
20101206010642.667|20101206010644.333|CCO|>> HE'S PLAYING ACOUSTIC GUITAR 
20101206010644.333|20101206010646.000|CCO|AND SINGING INTO A BOOM BOX.
20101206010646.000|20101206010647.667|CCO|IT WAS INCREDIBLE.
20101206010647.667|20101206010649.333|CCO|IT WAS MAGICAL.
20101206010649.333|20101206010651.000|CCO|>> Narrator: BUT ALONG WITH HIS 
20101206010651.000|20101206010653.000|CCO|INSPIRATION CAME A NEW SENSE OF 
20101206010653.000|20101206010655.000|CCO|MORTALITY.
20101206010655.000|20101206010657.000|CCO|>> HE TALKED ABOUT IT QUITE 
20101206010657.000|20101206010659.000|CCO|OFTEN.
20101206010659.000|20101206010701.000|CCO|I HAVE NEVER WORKED WITH AN 
20101206010701.000|20101206010703.500|CCO|ARTIST THAT HAD A SENSE OF HIS 
20101206010703.500|20101206010706.000|CCO|OWN DEMISE.
20101206010706.000|20101206010708.500|CCO|>> Narrator: AND AS LENNON 
20101206010708.500|20101206010711.000|CCO|CONTEMPLATED DEATH, THERE WAS 
20101206010711.000|20101206010713.500|CCO|SOMEONE COMING, A MAN WITH 
20101206010713.500|20101206010716.000|CCO|VOICES IN HIS HEAD, LURKING IN

20101206011134.750|20101206011136.000|CCO|HIM.

20101206011137.250|20101206011138.500|CCO|HONOLULU, A PARADISE FOR SOME.
20101206011138.500|20101206011139.750|CCO|BUT IN THE TWISTED WORLD OF MARK
20101206011139.750|20101206011141.000|CCO|DAVID CHAPMAN'S MIND, THERE WAS 
20101206011141.000|20101206011143.500|CCO|TORMENT.

20101206011201.000|20101206011203.500|CCO|VERY TROUBLED MAN.

20101206011206.000|20101206011208.500|CCO|DIVORCE, IF YOU DON'T DO THIS,

20101206011222.667|20101206011224.333|CCO|SARCASTIC AND HE HIT ME REAL 
20101206011224.333|20101206011226.000|CCO|HARD LIKE ON MY EAR.

20101206011227.667|20101206011229.333|CCO|BAD.

20101206011231.000|20101206011233.000|CCO|IMAGINED HE WAS GOING TO BE.
20101206011233.000|20101206011235.000|CCO|>> Narrator: JIM GAINS WAS A 
20101206011235.000|20101206011237.000|CCO|YOUNG REPORTER IN THE 1980s, 
20101206011237.000|20101206011239.000|CCO|WORKING ON A BOOK ABOUT LENNON'S

20101206011657.667|20101206011659.333|CCO|>>> I HAD READ THE CATCHER IN 
20101206011659.333|20101206011701.000|CCO|THE RYE.

20101206011705.000|20101206011707.000|CCO|EVERY BOOK IN THE LIBRARY, I 
20101206011707.000|20101206011709.000|CCO|MEAN LITERALLY.

20101206011711.000|20101206011712.667|CCO|GETTING THESE SWELLS OF, OF 
20101206011712.667|20101206011714.333|CCO|WHATEVER, YOU KNOW THEY WERE.
20101206011714.333|20101206011716.000|CCO|AND I BROUGHT HOME THIS PAPER

20101206011934.000|20101206011935.000|CCO|            IT WAS 1975.
20101206011935.000|20101206011936.000|CCO|    
20101206011936.000|20101206011937.000|CCO|    MY PROFESSOR AT BERKELEY
